Perform calculation while waiting for primers to defrost. Always add a few spare wells to ensure enough master mix is made as Sybr Green is very viscous and difficult to pipette precisely.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9dnb9","text":"Use a dedicated set of pipettes and try to be as clean as possible. Ensure primers efficiency is satisfactory. Include wells with no cDNA as amplification control.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3msvm","text":"Run samples in triplicates. tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"an888","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a66a","text":"Dilute stock of cDNA. A 1:5 or 1:10 dilution is normally sufficient to detect most genes and to have enough cDNA for all the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q6s8","text":"Pipette   cDNA in each well assigned to the same samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0avd","text":"Pipette   mastermix in each well assigned to the same primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bj7mk","text":"When all plate is completed, seal the plate and quickly centrifuge it to prevent bubble interference.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgbh0","text":"Put the plate in a thermal cycler designed for quantitative measurements. .","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"length":1,"offset":106},{"key":9,"length":1,"offset":112},{"key":10,"length":1,"offset":115},{"key":11,"length":1,"offset":121},{"key":12,"length":1,"offset":166}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qn9f","text":"Finally, {"blocks":[{"key":"6q16i","text":"The following sections outlined analysis of PCR data using the ΔΔCt method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":66,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fe7g","text":"For each sample and for each gene, calculate the average Ct value of the technical triplicate,, checking that intra-replicate variation is acceptable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":58,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rjgp","text":"For each sample, calculate the geometric mean of the Ct value of the housekeeping genes (Ct HKG)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":54,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":90,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bg5il","text":"For each sample and for each gene of interest, subtract the average Ct HKG value (from step 11) from the average Ct value calculated at step 10 to obtain the ΔCt GOI for each sample and for each gene of interest","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":69,"length":5},{"style":"sub","offset":114,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":160,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccv09","text":"For each gene of interest, average the ΔCt GOI for the control samples (untreated) across your experimental replicates to obtain the control ΔCt GOI ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":41,"length":5},{"style":"sub","offset":143,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c44p7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3nkbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":98,"style":"sub"}],"key":"6uk1j","text":"Both arithmetic and geometric mean can be used, the latter is particularly appropriate when the ΔCt values across experimental replicates are quite dispersed.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3gk5p","text":"Normalising by averaging across experimental replicates allows to have an error bar also for the control group. If the normalization is performed intra-experiment, all control points will be at 1, without error bars and affecting statistical analysis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5s6h","text":"For each gene of interest, calculate the ΔΔCt GOI by subtracting the control ΔCt GOI from the ΔCt GOI for each sample and for each experimental replicates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":44,"length":5},{"style":"sub","offset":79,"length":5},{"style":"sub","offset":96,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":69,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kann","text":"At this point, you should have, for each gene of interest and for each sample, n ΔΔCt GOI where n is the number of experimental replicates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":84,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":89,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qn0q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"83ds0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fui6s","text":"Perform the appropriate statistical analysis at this step, has the pints will most likely be normally distributed. In the last step, the normality will be possibly lost.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1g37p","text":"In order to plot the result, use the Fold change for each gene of interest by using the following formula for each data point:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"303vp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdmk9","text":"FC=2^(-ΔΔCt GOI)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9idlt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
